DataElement.preferredName: Optional Blood Specimen Biorepository Storage Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the type of condition under which the optional blood specimen was stored.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to an optional specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes and the storage of biospecimens that includes tissue samples, fluids, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA, and proteins collection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.:Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A storage facility of biospecimens that includes tissue samples, fluids, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA, and proteins. The biorepository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage, and documentation of biological specimens.:Collected; brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: A storage facility of biospecimens that includes tissue samples, fluids, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA, and proteins. The biorepository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage, and documentation of biological specimens.
Collected; brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The type of storage in which a part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis is placed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.: No Value Exists: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.

Concepts.definition: The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.
Indicates that a drug or therapy should be used as specified by the prescribing physician.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.description: If the optional blood specimen for serum banking WAS NOT shipped on the day of collection, under what conditions was the specimen stored?
